moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4: theory dictates Bc5, c3, Nf6, d4, etcetera, leading to some breed of the Italian party: this opening is usually - providing sound play from both players - not leading to very much; so I decided to go about this differently...
moves.3... Nd4: a rather innocent move: after Nxd4, exd4, we live on happily ever after; but White spots an attack: so he thinks...
moves.4. Nxe5: rook in the pocket for White, after Nxf7: so it seems...
moves.4... Qg5: but this changes things a bit: a crossfire on e5 and g2...
moves.5... Qxg2 6. Rf1: forced: losing the rook means mate...
moves.10. Ke3 Bxd1 11. Rxg2 Nf3 12. Nxh8: time to collect the prize, says White: but now it's Blacks' turn again...
moves.13... O-O-O: forcing the Black King into a deadly pin...
moves.14. Nf7: salvaging the Knight, before it's too late...
moves.16. Nxf3: here White first played Nc3: at a quick glance, a very sound development move: but after Ne5+, it is suddenly a choked mate; so White played this...
moves.18... dxe4+ 19. Kxe4 Nf6+ 20. Ke5: after long and careful thought, White came up with this: it is hard to find a better one, because Black will have it his way in any variation...
moves.20... Ng4+ 21. Kf5 Nxf2: at this point, Black is a full rook behind: but the sorry bunch on the other side of the board leaves much to desire...
moves.22... Rf7+: but White missed this: Nf2 is blocking the King away from covering Rf3...
moves.24. Na4: White needs to find ways to develop...
moves.24... Rf6+ 25. Kd5 b6 26. c3 Nd3: just in time to prevent d4...
moves.27. Ke4: White needs to get out of this spot...
moves.27... Rd6 28. b4 Bf2 29. Bb2: a costly way to develop, but White has to do something...
we are reaching the end of the attack: time to make the most of it...
moves.34. Kf3 Rxa4 35. Rxf2: safer this way: after Kxf2, Ra2+, Black can trade the rooks at his leasure in a won position or just outplay the White rook...
moves.35... a5: losing no time: Black needs to make the most of his pawn advantage...
moves.36. bxa5 Rxa5: better than bxa5: we are still looking for ways to trade rooks...
moves.37. Kg4 Rc5 38. Rf3 Ke6: Rf7+ is in the air: time to protect the little ones...
moves.39. Re3+ Kf6 40. Rf3+ Kg6 41. Rf4: blocking Rc4+: but this move will backfire...
moves.43... Rc6: White is in zugzwang: there is no way, to keep the b6 from promotion and prevent mate at the same time; so he resigned...
